job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: management is helpful and work load is fair
cons: Expensive insurance and not accepted locally

job_title: IT Applications Support Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: patient care for the community
cons: lower wages and systems need more efficiency

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great cause, amazing nurses, hardworking staff
cons: My workload and tasks increased daily, but they were never willing to increase my pay by even .50 per hour. I asked to be made full-time so I could do my job better and afford childcare, but they were not interested so I resigned.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Location is the best as Santa Barbara is super beautiful and the downtown office is only minutes away from the beach! Employees are friendly and super helpful. There is a sense of family and teamwork throughout the agency. My supervisor trusts me to do my job but is available to answer questions when needed. All the employees truly believe in the mission of this non-profit and the agency is highly respected in the community.
cons: This is a non-profit organization and agency celebrations tend to be more low key compared to the extravagant affairs that for profit organizations have.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
The people that work at VNHC are here because they want a challenging position in health care where they can grow and give back to the community, at the same time.
I am pretty new here, but I have noticed a culture of enthusiastic, energetic people who get a real sense of fulfillment from being a part of the great team here.
cons: Being close to the beach is very tempting.

review_title: Great field staff poor management and training
job_title: RN Case Manager in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great location, patient population, and community. Field staff are supportive and friendly. Competitive benefits. Small radius for traveling, great support and auxiliary staff.
cons:
Lack of standardized training upon hire to support decision making and process in the field. 
Management does not listen to suggestion or support when in distress. 
Stress doesn’t equal pay

job_title: Patient Accounting Representative in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I enjoy the challenge of working with Insurance companies to get previously denied claims processed and paid.
cons: Working in the Finance Dept. doesn't allow me to work directly with patients as I have in my past jobs. I enjoy helping patient's decipher their billing problems or other billing issues.

job_title: Staff RN in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Patients are in their own environment and are more "teachable" than in the hospital.
cons: PAPERWORK and lack of instruction.

job_title: Hospice Nurse in Hueytown, AL
pros: The really nice patients
cons: Bad patients not wanting to listen

job_title: Clinical Manager in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Good benefits! Great team to work with.
cons: A lot of paperwork in this business.
